From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2024 Indian filmDukaanTheatrical Release PosterDirected bySiddharth–GarimaWritten by
Siddharth Singh
Garima Wahal
Produced by
S K Ahluwalia
Siddharth Singh
Garima Wahal
Srujan Yarabolu
Starring
Sikandar Kher
Monika Panwar
Monali Thakur
Cinematography
Anirban Chatterjee
Edited by
Satya Sharma
Music by
Shreyas Puranik
Productioncompanies
Waveband Productions
Kalamkaar Picture Productions
Release date
5 April 2024 (2024-04-05) (India)
Running time132 minutesCountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Dukaan is a 2024 Hindi-language comedy drama film written and directed by Siddharth Singh and Garima Wahal, and produced by S K Ahluwalia, Siddharth Singh, Garima Wahal, and Srujan Yarabolu, under the banner of Waveband Productions and Kalamkaar Picture Productions.[1] The film features Monika Panwar, Monali Thakur and Soham Majumdar as lead characters.[2]


Cast[edit]

Monika Panwar as Jasmine
Monali Thakur as Diya
Soham Majumdar as Armaan
Sikandar Kher as Sumer
Vrajesh Hirjee as Pramod Trivedi
Azhar J Malik
Hridansh Parekh as Jamaal
Romanch Soni
Release[edit]
Dukaan was released theatrically on 5 April 2024.[3]

Reception[edit]
Dhaval Roy of The Times of India rated this film 3 stars out of 5 stars and noted "Dukaan is an intriguing concept with a strong lead performance, but the execution falters, leaving one wanting more."[4] Sonal Pandya of Times Now rated this film 2 stars out of 5 stars and noted "From its unwieldy introduction to the syrupy closing scenes, Dukaan isn't quite sure about how to handle its initial message about found families and parenthood."[5]
Rohit Bhatnagar of The Free Press Journal said "If you are up for some Garba dance moves, want to delve into Gujarati culture, or want to watch a fresh face Monika Panwar at her best, risk it for yourself, else, Mimi and Chori Chori Chupke Chupke are a still far better bets."[6]
Sukanya Verma of Rediff.com rated 1/5 stars and asserts "Its callous perspective and comical treatment of a sensitive matter makes a complete hash of things."[7]

References[edit]


^ PTI (2024-02-28). "'Dukaan': Sidharth-Garima's Film On Surrogacy Starring Monika Panwar To Release On April 5". news.abplive.com. Retrieved 2024-04-09.

^ "Dukaan: A Visual-Emotional Operatic Womb With A View". TimesNow. 2024-04-04. Retrieved 2024-04-09.

^ Jayaraman, N. P. "'Nepotism days are over, it's time to shine with your talent': 'Dukaan' directors Siddharth & Garima". Deccan Herald. Retrieved 2024-04-09.

^ "Dukaan Movie Review : An intriguing concept that doesn't reach its full potential". The Times of India. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 2024-04-09.

^ "Dukaan Movie Review: Siddharth-Garima's Syrupy Surrogate Drama Is A Rushed Affair". TimesNow. 2024-04-05. Retrieved 2024-04-09.

^ "Dukaan Review: Monika Panwar, Sikandar Kher's Film Is Refurbished Version Of Kriti Sanon's Mimi With Some Garba Moves". Free Press Journal. Retrieved 2024-04-09.

^ "Review: This Dukaan Delivers Only Baloney!". Rediff. 5 April 2024.
